newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares gain 1.7 pct to new 2-mth high.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares gain 1.7 pct to new 2-mth high.

text.p: Istanbul shares rose an average 1.7 percent in hectic trade on Wednesday as a medium-term uptrend continued with the market testing new resistance at the index's 72,000 level, brokers said.
The IMKB-100 closed 1,204.48 points higher at 72,051.24, a new two-month high after Tuesday. The previous highest close was 72,758.08 on July 11.
It had leapt 2.4 percent yesterday after Monday's minor correction that followed last week's 7.3 percent surge.
"There was some selling today, but the market still looked good with the help of selective activity. It may try 73,000 levels tomorrow," said Huseyin Istanbullu from Meksa securities.
Brokers said activity again focused on shares of utilities and largely state owned firms which strongly move the market index with their large market capitalisations.
Trade volume jumped to 13.6 trillion lira ($150 million) from Tuesday's 12.4 trillion ($136.5 million).
